info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 11:28AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN HAND...SOUTHERN HYDE...SOUTHEASTERN HUGHES...NORTH CENTRAL LYMAN AND NORTHWESTERN BUFFALO COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM CDT... At 1227 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Lake Sharpe, or 16 miles northwest of Lower Brule, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Highmore, Stephan, Lake Sharpe, Joe Creek Rec Area, West Bend Rec Area, northern Lower Brule Reservation, and northwestern Crow Creek Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
